disclaimer: Disclaimer: The following response is provided for informational purposes only and should not be considered as professional architectural advice. Please consult with certified professionals regarding any design decisions. Disclaimer: The information below is based on my training data up to 2023 and might not reflect the latest building codes or local regulations.

rooms.description: A welcoming area with Vastu-compliant positioning for positive energy flow. Positioned at the West entrance of the plot to align with good feng shui and ensure a smooth entry.
A large multi-functional area serving as a buffer between the exterior and interior spaces. Designed for colonial aesthetics with traditional Indian elements.
Spacious room facing the garden, incorporating natural light. Vastu principles ensure that the living area is positioned to receive auspicious energy from the East side.
Adjacent to the Living Room for easy family gatherings. Positioned in a location that complements Vastu principles by not being directly opposite the main entrance.
A modern colonial-style kitchen designed for functionality and convenience. Positioned away from sleeping quarters in accordance with Vastu principles to maintain purity.
A utility bathroom located near the living area for guests; designed following modern colonial aesthetics and efficient space utilization.
Integrated servantâ€™s quarters including a compact kitchenette, small bedroom, and bathroom. Designed to ensure privacy and ease of access while maintaining the overall colonial aesthetic.

openings.description: Double door entrance at the west facing side to harness positive energy flow in line with Vastu principles. Provides secure and inviting access.
Strategically placed windows along north and east facades for natural light while maintaining privacy. Colonial shutters are recommended.
Large sliding door connecting the living area to the outdoor space, ideal for enjoying scenic views of the garden and pool area.
Separate entrance designed for efficient movement of household staff. Placed discreetly in the south section to balance Vastu energy.

swimming_pool.description: A colonial-style swimming pool located towards the north-west corner of the plot for aesthetic appeal and relaxation. Designed with proper landscaping to enhance the overall farmhouse look.

levels.notes: The ground floor layout is designed to maximize natural light, adhere to Vastu principles (such as positioning of main entrance on the west and living spaces towards east), and maintain colonial aesthetics. The design incorporates servant's quarters for privacy and operational efficiency, along with a swimming pool integrated into the overall landscaping plan.

rooms.description: The primary bedroom features generous space, en-suite bathroom, and a private balcony facing east to ensure positive energy flow. Colonial design elements are blended with modern comforts.
Three additional bedrooms designed for family members or guests. Each room is spacious and includes integrated storage solutions, following Vastu guidelines for sleeping areas.
A shared terrace area offering outdoor living space with colonial balustrades and landscaped garden view. Designed to provide a seamless connection between indoor and outdoor environments.
Common family bathroom designed for daily convenience. Ensures privacy while maintaining alignment with the overall floor plan and Vastu recommendations.

openings.description: Windows integrated into the balcony area for natural light and ventilation. Colonial style windows with traditional shutters are recommended.
Separate entry door to the master bedroom ensuring privacy and direct access from the terrace.

levels.notes: The first floor focuses on residential living spaces. Bedrooms are designed with ample space and Vastu-aligned positioning. The inclusion of a shared balcony provides an outdoor retreat and enhances communal interaction.
